intro: Gastrolobium hians, commonly known as the slender wattle, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, featuring narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers in dense, cylindrical spikes during the spring and summer seasons. It is characterized by its woody, fibrous stems and is often found in sandy or rocky soils. Gastrolobium hians is part of the Fabaceae family, which includes many leguminous plants known for their nitrogen-fixing abilities.
